answers.answer: Hello,As a general guideline, gentle exercise is ok if the symptoms are head up. However, neck down or if you have a fever you should rest and not exercise.Walking should be fine, but do listen to your body.  If you are sick for more than 2 or 3 days or the symptoms are worrying see your doctor.Cold and flu can also result in elevated blood sugars.  if your sugars are higher than normal please contact your doctor.Please also be sure to stay well hydrated.If you are vomiting or can't drink contact your doctor.

I dont think so. With a bad cold, you should stay in bed, sleep alot, drink lots of  tea and water, and have a huge pot of selfmade chicken soup with ginger and carrots.Exercise is able to force the bugs even deeper into your system, as well as lower your immune system. Exercise is good for prevention, but not if you already caught it. Please be safe, have a hot bath and go back to bed.If the cold is long and ongoing, you might want to visit the amazonian house of your nearest Zoo. Sit there with a good book for a few hours, since the air is warm and moist and helps breathing. Get vicks vapo rub and do some steam inhalation at home, it will help, too.

Hello,All answers are essentially the same.  If you have a severe cold (muscle pain and fever, or chest pain /congestion) don't 'exercise'.If the cold is milder with symptoms 'neck up" then exercise is ok (can reduce intensity) and may even help you feel better.
